how do i use this mod when i do a docking with mechjeb?

It will automatically open when you select a docking port as your "control from here" part and select a docking port as target on the other vessel. While it's not strictly needed with Mechjeb, I use it with MJ to monitor the progress of the docking, especially because it gives accurate closing speed and distance between docking ports readings. During long automatic maneuvers (like moving a tug from one end of a station to the other) I find this handy because MJ is somewhat opaque as to what it's actually doing. In other cases, MJ can sometimes try and approach with (IMO) too high a lateral velocity, this mod lets me detect that, disable autodocking, and tap 'H' (or 'N' as appropriate) to kill the closing velocity and allow for better lateral alignment before re-enabling autodocking.

A very easy way to dock quickly using mechJeb 2 and Docking port Alignment.

Let's say you want to dock your Lander to an Orbiter.

Make approach to be between 200 and 100m from Orbiter. Orbiter as been designed as target for the Lander

When you are less than 1000m, jump to the Orbiter and select the Lander as Target. And then use MECHJEB, Smart ASS, Target +. That way your Orbiter will always point towards your Lander.

Now jump back to Lander, once Relative velocity is<1, use ASAS target + to point your lander towards your Orbiter

When less than 200m, You click "set as target" when selecting the Orbiter docking clamp o tron. Docking port alignment window appears. Yellow and green circles should be centered

You select "control from here" from the Lander clamp o tron.

Then switch off Smart ASS and use RCS to control Your lander. Use of RCS should be minimised because this way both ships stay aligned, you just have to take care of velocity and warp to save time.
